p: A piece of sterilized paper was experimentally contaminated with a higher titer virus 10 5 TCID 50/mL, equivalent to that of fecal excreta. The sample was allowed to be absorbed at RT for 3 h, then placed into a VeroE6 cell culture tube, and no viral infectivity was detected. With 10 6 TCID 50/mL, no viral infectivity was shown after 24 h. A higher concentration of 10 4 virus that was dropped on paper and allowed to dry at RT showed no viral infectivity within 5 min. Usually the viral titer in nasopharyngeal aspirate specimens is 10 2.2 TCID 50/mL[ 35]. Therefore, the risk of infection by contact with a droplet contaminated paper is small. Hand washing after touching potential materials is effective against SARS-CoV-2 transmission.
